newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai plans to expand port container capacity.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai plans to expand port container capacity.

text.p: Shanghai plans to dredge the Yangtse River mouth and build six new berths in the Pudong development zone to expand its container handling capacity by 50 percent, the China Daily Business Weekly said on Sunday.

The paper said the new container berths, to be built in the Waigaoqiao area, would have a handling capacity of 1.2 million standard containers per year, raising Shanghai's total capacity to some three million containers by the year 2000.
A Shanghai city official said they were waiting for final approval from the Ministry of Communications in Beijing for the project which includes dredging of the Yangtse River estuary.
"Water in the estuary is now only seven metres deep, making it impossible for big container ships to enter," the official said.
The estuary at present can only handle fully-loaded 10,000-tonne ships, but with dredging could handle 50,000-tonne vessels, the paper said.
